description: A guide or manual outlining the processes, procedures, and best practices for procurement contracts within an organization.
A method of dispute resolution involving one or more neutral third parties who render a binding or non-binding decision.
The process of resolving conflicts or disagreements between parties, which may include negotiation, mediation, arbitration, or litigation.
The transfer of rights, obligations, or duties under a contract from one party to another.
The replacement of an existing contract with a new one, involving the consent of all parties. It transfers both rights and obligations.
A change in the controlling ownership of a company, often triggering specific contractual provisions.
The process of determining the meaning of the terms and provisions of a contract.
A clause in a contract that limits the amount or type of damages for which a party may be liable.
A contractual obligation requiring a party to make a diligent and reasonable effort to fulfill its obligations, but not necessarily guaranteeing a specific outcome.
